Name: Dummy canopic jar
Description: A dummy canopic jar in the form of the baboon-headed Hepi, one of the four Sons of Horus. Hepi extended his protection to the lungs of the deceased. The features are clearly defined and well-executed.By the 3rd Intermediate Period the viscera were usually returned to the mummified body rather than stored in canopic jars, but empty or dummy jars were sometimes still included in burials to ensure protection from the four Sons of Horus.
